attachments.title: Spot's Got an Arm!
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Spot's Got an Arm!
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6Zbhvaac68Y?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: those are starting to look really impressive, but I always have to wonder how contrived the situations in the video we see are, whether they can truly act autonomously or have to be shepherded around

elements.text: those are starting to look really impressive, but I always have to wonder how contrived the situations in the video we see are, whether they can truly act autonomously or have to be shepherded around

text: Even if they need manual remote control, they can be very useful. If they can go into dangerous situations without putting humans at risk, that's a huge win

elements.text: Even if they need manual remote control, they can be very useful. If they can go into dangerous situations without putting humans at risk, that's a huge win

text: Especially the Spot Enterprise looks useful. It can re-charge itself in a dock.

elements.text: Especially the Spot Enterprise looks useful. It can re-charge itself in a dock.

text: Now only you need to put a gun in its arm and you’ve got a remote soldier. :ahhhhhhh:

elements.text: Now only you need to put a gun in its arm and you’ve got a remote soldier.
